intro: Hieracium ovatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular florets. Hieracium ovatum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
